turn.1: How do you propose they are all avoidable? Sure, some of them are from people being idiots and not using birth control. But a lot are from birth control failing. Which, in a way, is a valid point. But given the way humans are, that's not a feasable advice and not something you can base your argument on. Plus, people have tried that, by having abstinence only sex ed. That leads to a lot of teenage pregnancies. I think we can safely conclude that preaching abstinance as a form of birth control doesn't really work.
